text: I thought the kids in our neighborhood had taken to wearing saran wrap as fashion, but then  remembered we live by a bunch of tattoo shops.
E.T. + R2D2 + Matrix Prequel + romance = Wall-E. Best dystopian nightmare future anti-consumerist animated kids' movie I've seen all year.
Undoing any positive effects of exercise through rapacious consumption of octopus, pig and noodles. And ice cream. And...
Everybody on the subway winced as the woman's iPod slipped from her hand and fell between the platform and train.
If you Digg, my piece on Bill Gates' greatest hack just got submitted: http://tinyurl.com/3nwgd5 Show me some love!
I like to look at Bill Gates as having unilaterally enacted a $100/yr. per employee "trying to cure AIDS" tax. http://icanhaz.com/gateshack
@newyorkerdotcom I am thrilled to see @sashafrerejones begin his beef with Kanye West, & hope it yields good YouTube videos. With AutoTune.
People who sing along to songs from "Grease" should be deported. If they perform hand motions while singing, deported to the moon.
Half a dozen random meetings today confirm, NYC is a great city for geeks.
@giovanni good to meet you! "I know you by your buddy icon" is an awesome way to have someone introduce himself. :)
In conclusion, I am in favor of puppies. I defy you to contradict me.
I would do anything to get this out of my head. http://icanhaz.com/shaqass There are no words.
Both @jeffjarvis and @scobleizer brought their sons to Personal Democracy Forum. Would love to see some daughters next year, too. #pdf2008
just got a spam msg with the subject "set your wife on fire". you know, i was raised hindu, and i feel this message is hate speeching me.
my neighbors' best wifi network names: "YankeesSuck", "my beeotch", "Harold", "O_o", "Towelie", "Fuck Off Christine", "waffle fries"
Sad that NYC hipsters aren't yet wearing parachute pants. Once they do, it's only months until I can bust out the vintage Cross Colours.
ROFL! just got a call from yahoo accounting asking what department i'm in, since an expense report was submitted in my name.
i like the presenters at the Personal Democracy Forum every year, but this year the Jazz @ Lincoln Center venue makes it kick even more ass.
Walking by the bake sale for Obama, and I am pleased to see there are black-and-white cookies.
We're sitting next to Tricky and he is lamenting having forgotten his Blackberry charger. I can totally relate!
Excuse me, sir, your really buff arms had kept me from noticing that you were short! Nice work.
Trying to choose which one of several good burger joints to visit. First Law of Nom-nom-nomics dictates that we try all of them.
We had sliced pig fat for dinner and now my wife is stomping around the house singing "Highway to Hell". It must be Friday night!
NYC friends: drinks at 6A NYC office right now -- if you know where it is, you're invited. :)
@cruftbox we do!
and in other browser-related news, firefox 3 seems fine enough, but the new website for it is absolutely fantastic. great, great work.
...and then I realized Apple had made a built-in feature for Safari designed specifically for surfing porn sites. genius!
was just looking at Safari's private browsing and thought, "how the hell does that help make shopping secure?
Oh no, Michelle Obama, what have you done?! http://icanhaz.com/mofistbump Fist-bumping Barbara Walters! NOOOOOOOOOOOO
OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!
Between taxis and school buses, every vehicle on this block is bright yellow. It's like traffic is yelling GOOOOD MORNING!!!!
Shuttle Chips Shipped - Cheap! http://icanhaz.com/cheapchips A rumination on buying space shuttle parts on eBay. I love blogging. :)
"if you live entirely within the imaginary world i've constructed in my head, this all makes perfect sense!"
@vidiot_ of all the OCD friends who responded, your recommendation of http://www.metrocardbonuscalculator.com/ beats all!
NYC subway fare is $2.00. My metrocard currently has an $8.28 balance on it. These 28 cents are going to haunt me for the rest of my days.
Kickass! Serious Eats is one of Time's Top 50 Websites. http://icanhaz.com/eats (Vote early, vote often!)
Pretty sure that no dad I know, including my own, actually wants *presents* on Father's Day. Presence, maybe.
@cshirky for lack of a better analogy, d msgs are more effective than regular tweets if you want to invite a diverse audience to an event.
A nice early Sunday morning in Central Park. It's not even swampy-hot yet.
headed to UCB to see @jsmooth995 @zefrank et al.
R. Kelly's triumph with the Shaggy "It Wasn't Me" defense must surely mark a milestone in American legal history.
Never figured I'd write a blog post citing the Dep't of Homeland Security. Heh. (See: http://icanhaz.com/secure )
I wonder how many members of Huey Lewis' backing band have journalism degrees.
Going to bed late, waking up early + running all day isn't working as well as it did when I was 22. On the other hand, now I have credit.
Please think about the environment before printing out and archiving all of my tweets. While drinking crude oil.
Starting to understand why Hendrix wrote a song about crosstown traffic...
@ChristianBurns wow, thanks! I really had fun with that one. :)
stand back -- i know powerpoint!
I gotta say, it's pretty cool to see the TypePad logo here: http://www.apple.com/iphone/features/appstore.html
@sippey you were awesome! Truly did justice to TypePad for iPhone. :) way to go.
Ah, summertime in NYC... Beautiful young people wearing next to nothing, a languid pace, and everywhere the smell of warm urine and garbage.
My wife left to "go to the ATM" and came back with two pork BBQ sandwiches and no cash. No wonder I married her.
Nothing says "morning after" like.a pair of white Kanye window-blinds sunglasses lying broken and discarded on the sidewalk on Saturday a.m.
Church across the street is having a dance for young teens + the MC just admonished the kids to "keep it clean". I love my neighborhood.
My platform is that anyone who suffixes the word "Vegas" with "baby" loses the right to vote. Who's with me? (Or, who's with me, baby?)
I keep thinking of really obnoxious, offensive tweets and then panic that I'm logged in as @sixapart. You guys would forgive me, right? Heh.
Just left work to watch my wife judge a latte contest. She's kind of the Simon Cowell of foam.
Holy crap @barackobama now look what you've done! http://icanhaz.com/cnnfistbump Think about the children!
made a rare trip into writing about politics, over on my vox blog: http://anil.vox.com/
@choire joins the ranks of people who greet me by asking where my wife is. Those people have good taste.
@barackobama i need to know that your presidency is not going to result in more public fist-bumping. even between husband and wife.
@torrez "jammin' on the 1" is basically audible proof that singers don't trust drummers to be able to count to 1 without being reminded.
Usually happy to do the civic thing when summoned for jury duty. Right now? Jetlagged and dreading getting up early to go downtown.
Can't help but feel Bill and Hillary should have Al Gore come over for dinner and explain YouTube to them.
I am staring at a very large SUV with an American flag ribbon *and* a big "Go Solar" bumper sticker. Guess I just met my first swing voter.
Sometimes getting to work with friends all day seems like we're getting away with a scam.
Ran into the Governator. Well, *that* was weird, but he was nice enough.
Hanging out with family means passing from "I'm full, I ate a lot!" to "These sorts of gastronomic stunts are covered by ESPN these days."
Enjoying an episode of an Indian family reality show whose theme is dads cross-dressing and having a danceoff while lipsyncing. In saris.
